greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n such that each term of the partition is a squared divisor of n.
example: a(n=12)=5 counts these 5 partitions of 12: 1^2+1^2+..+1^2 = 1^2+1^2+...+1^2+2^2 = 1^2+1^2+..+1^2+2^2+2^2 = 1^2+1^2+1^2+3^2=2^2+2^2+2^2. Partitions with the divisors 4, 6 or 12 do not contribute to the count because 4^2, 6^2 and 12^2 are larger than n.
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 03 2009
